latestIgtvVideos.caption:
You'll only know if you'll make it or not, only if you make an attempt to do it in the first place.
We ask everyone to #ChooseToChallenge against gender-based stereotypes, biases, disparities and inequities, today and everyday - and make an inclusive world for everyone.

 

A special thanks to @dlfmallofindia and all other partnering brands - @socialoffline , @forevernew_india , @skechersindia , @veromodaindia , @kamaayurveda and @geetanjalisalon - for supporting us in this global initiative.@imanumeena @smritology @suhavini @iamoliviadeka

latestIgtvVideos.title: Nisha: an acid attack survivor, please donate in link in bio
latestIgtvVideos.caption: Another one bites the dust. No, this isn’t some fairytale romance where the Prince Charming was a frog. This is another woman who was attacked with acid. She was rehabilitated by @makeluvnotscars and lives at our rehabilitation center. She’s my friend. We’re raising funds for more survivors like her - please DONATE IN LINK IN BIO.

latestIgtvVideos.title: My request as an acid attack survivor. Share please :)
latestIgtvVideos.caption: Hi everyone, I was 17 years old when I was attacked with acid. I overcame suicide attempts and depression to become the first acid attack survivor to walk the New York fashion week. Today, I published my memoir called Being Reshma and it would be a dream come true if people would read my book. I’d be humbled if you would join me in my journey to ending gender based crimes and purchase my memoir on amazon! The first key to change is spreading awareness and I hope my book inspires you to make a difference in your communities. 💕💕#video #bookshelf #memoir #shelfie #viral #survivor #secrets #readers #bookshelf #bookstagram

latestPosts.caption:
After nearly 28 years of being ignored by the system, Reshma Ansari—an acid attack survivor—finally received support from the PM’s Relief Fund. This only became possible after Brave Souls Foundation, led by fellow survivor Shaheen Malik, stepped in to fight for her rights.

This is not a celebration—it's a reminder of the painful delays and neglect survivors face in India. Brave Souls Foundation continues to stand by Reshma, offering medical aid, food support, and legal help—because no survivor should suffer alone.

#BraveSoulsFoundation #ReshmaAnsari #AcidAttackSurvivor #JusticeDelayed #EndGenderViolence #SupportSurvivors

Against all odds, love triumphs 💍✨ 

Member of Brave Souls Foundation, Reshma Bano Qureshi, acid attack survivor and beacon of courage, begins a beautiful new chapter with the love of her life, Mohd. Naim Ansari. 

All of us at BSF send heartfelt congratulations to the inspiring couple. ❤️ 

#LoveWins #ReshmaQureshi #BraveSouls #LoveIsLove #CoupleGoals

"Acid attack survivors carry more than just physical scars — they carry invisible wounds that society often overlooks."

Shaheen Malik, Director of Brave Souls Foundation, has spent years walking beside survivors — listening to their stories, advocating for their rights, and challenging a system that too often silences them.

The trauma of an acid attack doesn't end in the hospital. It shows up in courtrooms, in job interviews, in stares on the street, and in the daily fight for dignity and justice. 

At Brave Souls Foundation, we believe every survivor deserves not just to survive, but to live with pride, purpose, and power. 

Video Credit: Charitism

 
#BraveSoulsFoundation #ShaheenMalik #AcidAttackSurvivors #FromTraumaToHealing #SupportSurvivors #EndAcidViolence #JusticeAndDignity

In every scar lies a story of strength, and in every smile, a shared journey of healing. These brave souls, bound by courage and sisterhood, show us what true power looks like — not in solitude, but in solidarity.

Brave Souls Foundation creates a space where healing happens, not just individually, but together. 

#BraveSoulsFoundation #BraveSouls #UnbreakableTogether #HealingInSisterhood #StrengthInUnity #SupportAndSurvival #ResilienceInAction #RiseAbove #EmpoweredTogether

She’s a Chapter you’ll never skip, full of Fight, Faith & Fire❤️💯

MUAH -  @bijalgadamakeovers 
BRIDE -  @beingreshma 

#bijalgadamakeovers #bijalgada #bijalgadabrides #makeupartist #indianmakeupartist #bridalmakeupartist #survivorvoices #womenempowerment #supportsuvivors #bravesouls #inspiration

She’s a fighter, a survivor, a strong woman who never backs down.💁‍♀️🫶🏻

Today, her D-day arrives, Marrying the Love of her Life, the one who’s been her Rock, her strength, for the last 10 years.🥹😘💯❤️

They survived the unthinkable — now they're rewriting their stories.

At Brave Souls Foundation, we’re helping acid attack survivors heal, rebuild, and thrive — with shelter, medical care, and support for a new livelihood.

You can be part of their journey. 

Click the link in bio or visit https://tinyurl.com/52njtb62 to stand with them.

REPOST from @give_india

Rahat’s story is one of unimaginable pain, but also extraordinary strength. As an acid attack survivor, she has faced a lifetime of suffering and stigma. Yet, her courage to rebuild and rise above is a beacon of hope for all survivors. Brave Souls stands with Rahat and countless others, offering them shelter, medical care, and the chance for a fresh start.

Their scars run deep, but their resilience is even deeper. Let’s turn pain into power and help them heal, rise, and reclaim their lives.

Support Brave Souls.

https://tinyurl.com/4cj5wj89

REPOST from @give_india

Shaheen Malik was once an ambitious young woman, eager to build a successful career. But an acid attack shattered her dreams and thrust her into a battle for justice and survival. Despite the trauma, her journey fueled her determination to help others, leading her to found Brave Souls, an NGO supporting over 200 acid attack survivors. Through her strength and resilience, Shaheen offers medical care, shelter, and hope to women facing similar struggles. Join her fight and support these courageous women by donating today. Click the link in the bio now or visit- 

https://tinyurl.com/4kxdf7m8

COMPENSATION RECEIVED!

On June 29, 2005, Bhawna Chaudhary was walking home from the market in Meerut with her sister when a man, enraged by her refusal to marry him, threw acid on them. Bhawna suffered devastating injuries to her face, neck, and eyes, while her sister also sustained burns.

But Bhawna didn’t give up.

Despite enduring 18 painful surgeries, a damaged voice, and ongoing medical challenges, she continues to fight for justice, dignity, and survival. In 2013, Bhawna met Shaheen Malik, and with her support, she finally secured ₹5 lakh in compensation — at a time when she had lost hope.

Recently, with continued efforts by Brave Souls Foundation, Bhawna received an additional ₹1 lakh in compensation. This amount had been long overdue, with multiple representations ignored by authorities. It was only after the intervention of the Allahabad High Court that the funds were finally released. While we’re relieved the compensation came through, it is disheartening that it took so many years.

Brave Souls Foundation also supports her daughter’s education and medical treatment. We remain committed to standing by Bhawna on her journey of resilience and recovery.

latestPosts.caption:
Justice Delayed, Healing Denied: Acid Attack Survivors Battle A Legal System Indifferent To Their Trauma & Suffering.

Featured by : @article14live 

#justice #legal #awareness
latestPosts.alt: Photo shared by Brave Souls Foundation on April 11, 2025 tagging @farha905, @beingreshma, and @shaheenmalikbsf. May be an image of 1 person, magazine, newspaper, poster and text that says 'Л14 ARTICLE 14 Justice Delayed, Healing Denied: Acid Attack Survivors Battle A Legal System Indifferent To Their Trauma & Suffering Shaheen Malik, an acid attack victim turned activist, was attacked by her colleagues and boss in 2009 when she rebuffed his advances. She still waiting for justice 16 years later, having been to nearly 100 court hearings'.

childPosts.alt: Photo shared by Brave Souls Foundation on April 11, 2025 tagging @farha905, @beingreshma, and @shaheenmalikbsf. May be an image of 1 person, magazine, newspaper, poster and text that says 'Л14 ARTICLE 14 Justice Delayed, Healing Denied: Acid Attack Survivors Battle A Legal System Indifferent To Their Trauma & Suffering Shaheen Malik, an acid attack victim turned activist, was attacked by her colleagues and boss in 2009 when she rebuffed his advances. She still waiting for justice 16 years later, having been to nearly 100 court hearings'.

Photo by Brave Souls Foundation on April 11, 2025. May be an image of 1 person, magazine, poster and text that says '"f was attacked in 2009, said Malik. "My trial started in 2014, and so far, I'm yet to see any positive development in my case." "AI want is justice. For me and for all those survivors whose cases are pending, she said. "I will continue this fight. don't want more blame games. What we really want now is action and justice."'.

Photo by Brave Souls Foundation on April 11, 2025. May be an image of poster and text that says '" "In my 16-year 16-, journey, I've seen countless such delays. Each time someone is missing-the lawyer, witness, investigating officer, or judge-my case gets pushed back by months, she said. "While for them, it might be just another date on the calendar; for me, it's three more months of living with my trauma, seeing my attacker walk free, three more months of Ty life put on hold.' "'.

latestPosts.caption:
Madhu, a resident of Tajganj, Agra, was just 17 years old when her life was irreversibly changed by a brutal acid attack. At the time, she  was in the first year of her graduation while also providing private tuition to young students to support her family. Following the passing of her father, she took on the responsibility of managing household expenses, determined to complete her education and create a better future for her family.

Due to the life-altering impact of the attack, Madhu remains unable to support herself or her family. She still requires additional surgeries, laser treatments, and long-term medical care, but she has no financial means to afford them. The lack of employment opportunities has left her in complete financial distress, making her struggle for survival an ongoing battle.
Despite the profound impact of the attack, Madhu has not yet received any compensation or financial support from the government. The emotional, physical, and financial burdens she carries highlight the urgent need for rehabilitation and assistance.

#WomenEmpowerment #StopSaleAcid #SurvivorVoices #Fighter #SupportSurvivors #BraveSouls
